original_title: Broadway's Dreamers: The Legacy of the Group Theatre
overview: A study of the Group Theatre, a company that changed the face of American drama. The Group was founded in 1931 by Cheryl Crawford, Harold Clurman and Lee Strasberg, who were strongly influenced by the naturalistic acting of Konstantin Stanislavskiâ€™s Moscow Art Theatre.
title: Broadway's Dreamers: The Legacy of the Group Theatre
